title: Ticket #5271: condor_q should show only current owner's jobs by default
description:
By default, condor_q should show only jobs owned by the current user (unless the user is a queue super-user).

If one or more user argument is specifed for condor_q, then only those owners' jobs will be shown. If no user argument is specifed, then a special value will be passed in the query ad for new schedds that means "add Owner==Me to the constraint". For older schedds Owner==<user> will be explicitly added to the constraint, with condor_q attempting to determine what value to use for <user>

Thus the condor_q results may be somewhat different when talking to older schedds. There are actually 3 cases.

  1. When talking to an 8.5.1 or later schedd, the V3 query protocol is used and it's the schedd who figures out what the value of <user> is.
  2. When Talking to an schedd that supports the V3 protocol but is older than 8.5.1, condor_q figures out what <user> is and adds an explicit constraint to the query.
  3. When talking to schedd that do not support the V3 protocol, condor_q adds an explicit constraint and figures out what <user> is.
remarks:
the new -all-users arg should be documented, and somehow this new default behavior needs to be mentioned in the manual.

as of 2016-Jan-28 12:34:59 this works only when using the V3 protocol and an 8.5.2 or later schedd.

2016-Jan-28 12:34:59 by bbockelm:
Is there a way to prevent the schedd from showing the other user's jobs? I.e., do not allow (newer) schedds to respond to -all-users unless it's a queue super user.

2016-Jan-28 15:09:51 by johnkn:
at present there is no way to do that, and we can't reliably do it with current capabilities because we can't guarantee we can always identify what user is running condor_q. If you make some assumptions about where users are allowed to run commands you can probably manage reliable authentication and with that we could make some small changes in the schedd to turn this behavior own whether the user requested it or not.

2016-Jan-29 09:56:14 by bbockelm:
Hi TJ,

The particular site I was thinking of indeed requires authentication for all read commands...

Brian

2016-Feb-12 15:31:10 by wenger:
This is now documented, so I'm going to resolve the ticket.
